Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with the highest amounts in eastern Sweetwater County and south of Interstate 80. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Rock Springs and Green River, Flaming Gorge and East
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Sweetwater County; Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 3:58AM MST until February 22 at 6:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations 6 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Northeast Bighorn Mountains. In Montana, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 3:58AM MST until February 22 at 6:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow, possibly heavy at times. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Montana. Portions of north central Wyoming.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 2:52AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches. Extremely dangerous wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre Mountain Ranges.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:52AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected. Locally higher amounts will be possible with narrow bands. Extremely dangerous wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero.
